TopicTitle: KSP Private Contracts Administration Department - The privatization of space - ship submissions

Articles.Content:
THE KERBAL SCIENCE JOURNAL

Headlines:

Budget cuts force the Kerbal Space Program to open its doors to private contractors

"There's just no change left in the budget jar any more" - Gene Kerman

Companies of Kerbin, the Kerbal Space Center is now offering free use of it's facilities to launch private missions. This could be the beginning of a new age of a free market for space exploration. Recent budget cuts have forced the KSP into financial troubles (mainly due to engineers at the KSC creating one too many wobbly rockets and paying compensation to one too many KIA kerbonauts).

The newly created Private Contractors Administration Department (PCAD) is now accepting ship and mission profile submissions. These submissions will be hyper edited into an integrated save file which will be periodically uploaded with a description of 'the story so far'. This will create a stock save file for engineers to use containing a universe filled with hundreds of ships, satellites, bases, probes etc.

The rules for submissions are as follows:

  • Ships must be STOCK (KSP refuses to sink as low as allowing private contractors to launch missions with their own parts).
  • Ship names must include a short acronym of the company name (for identification purposes and to prevent expensive lawsuits arguing about who owns which fancy space telescope).
  • Submissions must include a description of your company and what it specializes in.
  • Submissions must be uploaded with photo evidence that the ship can legitimately reach its intended hyper edit destination.
  • The ships intended hyper edit destination must be a stable, such as a parking orbit, or landed.

The PCAD is looking for a wide range of ships such as:

  • Satellites
    • Telescopes
    • Comms
    • Defense
    • Scientific
    • Etc

    [*]Probes

    [*]Bases

    [*]Stations

    [*]Rovers

    [*]Manned & unmanned ships

    • Scientific
    • Transport
    • Military
    • Exploration
    • Space planes
    • Etc

And any others.

I will be uploading the latest save file weekly including all the latest submissions.

And so the privatization of space begins.

"Why are you quoting me I have cost you literally billions in crashed ships" - Jebediah Kerman

This is a nice idea in my opinion.. I just got a few questions:

1. How will we start off?

Maybe I haven't read properly, but I haven't seen anything concerning how we are going to begin.

2. Do I necessarily need to have a company? I just have a little 'C7 Aerospace - Spaceplanes' thread (haven't found another Name yet), so I don't really have a serious company.

I can construct a basic SSTO which can bring up a small probe, probably ion-powered, up to LKO, which is then able to get in orbit around Mun or Minmus and maaybe even land there.

Tell me what you think.

Volcanix
